title: How to make a good audio visual presentation - Quora

response.answer_text: That depends on your standard for “good”. To deliver a basic, standing presentation, you should organize the information you wish to convey into a cohesive set of slides on Powerpoint, maybe embed a relevant video or two. The main issue is knowing your slide order, so you delivering your message as your audience sees it onscree, seamlessly and with no delays in transition. You’ll want to be using adequate audio equipment(microphone, speakers, etc.) to ensure you’re projecting and reaching the entire audience. If you want a sure fire professional presentation, a downstage confidence monitor that can be read from the podium can help keep you on track while onstage Another option that can be helpful is a system called Perfect Cue from a company called D San. It enables the presentter to signal a video technician stationed in the room to advance, reverse, or hold at current slide by way of a signal light placed on the tech table. So, those are a few elements to consider when creatin, planning and delivering a presentatioN.

what is your experience level with public speaking, powerpoint, and general AV concepts? As an AV pro, all kinds of things apring to mind. If you feel good about public speaking, then, translate your speech onto a fairly simplistic PowerPoint presentatio, as few slodes as necessary to deliver your message, maybe an embedded video or two. If necessary, you can hire a technician to advance, reverse or hold slide for your presentation(usually happens in larger venues on large or multiple screens) Finally, consider a downstage confidence monitor.
